is a city in Sagaing Division,

value: File:Row upon row of Buddha statues at Bodhi Tataung.jpeg

Non air-con bus is available from

(26th St, near 90th St). Trip takes about 3 hours including one break (20-30 min) for 2,000 kyat. It is probably safer to get the bus from bus station and have your seat booked. Bus appears to be quite frequent.

A local non air-con bus from

leaves at 07:30 and takes about 3-4 hours including several stops. Can be booked at the bus station (pay not more than 3,000 kyat, which is the locals price, haggle!), hotels charge about 5,000 kyat. The bus can pick you up along the main road.
Tuk-tuks are widely available. A tuk-tuk from the bus station to the city centre shouldn't cost more than 1,000 kyat.

value: content=Two big statues of Buddha and a golden pagoda which makes for a pretty amazing sight. One Buddha is standing and the another is lying on its side. You can enter the inside of the standing Buddha which consists of quite a few storeys. The images on the walls mostly depict hell.
directions=About 20 km southeast of Monywa, or about 30-45 min via tuk-tuk

content=Built between 1939 and 1952, the unique feature of this pagoda is its small sculptures of Buddha (said to be more than 500,000). There is a little tower just opposite the pagoda which can be climbed.
, there are many many mosquitoes so be prepared. You can buy repellent at every street shop.
mosquito repellent is an Indian generic and costs only 700 kyat for a 100 ml tube.
price=Double room with private bathroom and air-con is USD25 (May 2013)

content=Rooms look shabby, air-con cannot be adjusted and breakfast consists of cold fried eggs and toast. However the rooms are clean, you can refill purified water in the lobby and the Internet is one of the fastest in Myanmar (email, Facebook, even streaming a series was possible!). By far not as bad as described in
content= Room is not new, though fairly clean and equipped with new air-con. Bathroom is clean. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Tuk-tuk ride from bus station to this hotel cost 2,000 kyat.
name=New hotel between the Clock Tower and Bogyoke Statue
content=New (May 2013), expensive-looking hotel with promotional offers. Extremely friendly staff.
price=Cheapest double room with private bath, USD20 (May 2013)
content=Most popular guesthouse for tourists in Monywa. However the cheapest double rooms are really rundown, wet carpeting, leaking toilet, unclean. By far not as good as described in
. Can't say anything about the more expensive/newer rooms. No Internet!
